meanings.definition: An accounting term referring to losses or credits that can be applied to future tax years.
meanings.sent1: The company used carryforwards to reduce their tax liability for the next year.
meanings.sent2: The accountant explained how carryforwards can help offset future profits.
meanings.sent3: The carryforwards were like a savings account for taxes, waiting to be used when needed.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge of carryforwards was a valuable tool in managing the company's finances.
meanings.sent5: Remembering to utilize carryforwards can save a business money in the long run.

meanings.definition: The act of carrying something forward in time or space.
meanings.sent1: His carryforwards of supplies from the previous day made his work easier today.
meanings.sent2: The carryforwards of ideas from the meeting sparked new innovations in the project.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her carryforwards of snacks were like a time machine to satisfy future cravings.
meanings.sent4: The carryforwards of memories from childhood brought a sense of nostalgia to the present.
meanings.sent5: The carryforwards of knowledge from past experiences guided him in making better decisions.
